basics.description: **Note:** Please refer to the following before installing the solution: • Review the solution [Release Notes](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/master/Solutions/GoogleCloudPlatformIAM/ReleaseNotes.md) • There may be [known issues](https://aka.ms/sentinelsolutionsknownissues) pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing. The Google Cloud Platform Identity and Access Management (IAM) solution provides the capability to ingest [GCP IAM logs](https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/audit-logging) into Microsoft Sentinel using the GCP Logging API. Refer to [GCP Logging API documentation](https://cloud.google.com/logging/docs/api) for more information. **Underlying Microsoft Technologies used:** This solution takes a dependency on the following technologies, and some of these dependencies either may be in [Preview](https://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/preview-supplemental-terms/) state or might result in additional ingestion or operational costs: a. [Azure Monitor HTTP Data Collector API](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/data-collector-api) b. [Azure Functions](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/functions/#overview) **Data Connectors:** 1, **Parsers:** 1, **Workbooks:** 1, **Analytic Rules:** 10, **Hunting Queries:** 10, **Custom Azure Logic Apps Connectors:** 1, **Playbooks:** 3 [Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel](https://aka.ms/azuresentinel) | [Learn more about Solutions](https://aka.ms/azuresentinelsolutionsdoc)

metadata.hidden: Hiding location, we get it from the log analytics workspace

basics.name: getLAWorkspace
basics.toolTip: This filters by workspaces that exist in the Resource Group selected

basics.name: workspace
basics.label: Workspace
basics.toolTip: This dropdown will list only workspace that exists in the Resource Group selected

options.text: This Solution installs the data connector for GoogleCloudPlatformIAM. You can get GoogleCloudPlatformIAM custom log data in your Microsoft Sentinel workspace. After installing the solution, configure and enable this data connector by following guidance in Manage solution view.

The Solution installs a parser that transforms the ingested data into Microsoft Sentinel normalized format. The normalized format enables better correlation of different types of data from different data sources to drive end-to-end outcomes seamlessly in security monitoring, hunting, incident investigation and response scenarios in Microsoft Sentinel.

link.label: Learn more about connecting data sources

options.text: This solution installs workbook(s) to help you gain insights into the telemetry collected in Microsoft Sentinel. After installing the solution, start using the workbook in Manage solution view.
Sets the time name for analysis
This solution installs the following analytic rule templates. After installing the solution, create and enable analytic rules in Manage solution view.

elements.name: analytic1
elements.label: GCP IAM - Disable Data Access Logging

options.text: Detects when Data Access Logging is disabled.
Detects requests where user agent is empty.

elements.name: analytic3
elements.label: GCP IAM - High privileged role added to service account

options.text: Detects when high privileged role was added to service account.

elements.name: analytic4
elements.label: GCP IAM - New Authentication Token for Service Account

options.text: Detects when new authentication token is created for service account.
Detects new service account creation.

elements.name: analytic6
elements.label: GCP IAM - New Service Account Key

options.text: Detects new service account key creation.
Detects possible privileges enumeration.

elements.name: analytic8
elements.label: GCP IAM - Publicly exposed storage bucket

options.text: Detects possible misconfiguration for bucket policy making it publicly available.
Detects possible service account enumeration.

elements.name: analytic10
elements.label: GCP IAM - Service Account Keys Enumeration

options.text: Detects possible service account keys enumeration.
This solution installs the following hunting queries. After installing the solution, run these hunting queries to hunt for threats in Manage solution view.
Query searches for roles' modifications. This hunting query depends on GCPIAMDataConnector data connector (GCP_IAM Parser or Table)
Query searches for service accounts deleted for the last 24 hours. This hunting query depends on GCPIAMDataConnector data connector (GCP_IAM Parser or Table)
Query searches for service accounts disabled for the last 24 hours. This hunting query depends on GCPIAMDataConnector data connector (GCP_IAM Parser or Table)
Query searches for new custom roles created for the last 24 hours. This hunting query depends on GCPIAMDataConnector data connector (GCP_IAM Parser or Table)
Query searches for new service accounts created for the last 24 hours. This hunting query depends on GCPIAMDataConnector data connector (GCP_IAM Parser or Table)

elements.name: huntingquery6
elements.label: GCP IAM - New service account keys

options.text: Query searches for new service accounts keys created for the last 24 hours. This hunting query depends on GCPIAMDataConnector data connector (GCP_IAM Parser or Table)
Query searches for rare IAM actions by users. This hunting query depends on GCPIAMDataConnector data connector (GCP_IAM Parser or Table)
Query searches for rare user agents. This hunting query depends on GCPIAMDataConnector data connector (GCP_IAM Parser or Table)

elements.name: huntingquery9
elements.label: GCP IAM - Top service accounts by failed actions

options.text: Query searches for service accounts with top failed actions count. This hunting query depends on GCPIAMDataConnector data connector (GCP_IAM Parser or Table)

elements.name: huntingquery10
elements.label: GCP IAM - Top source IP addresses with failed actions

options.text: Query searches for source IP addresses with top failed actions count. This hunting query depends on GCPIAMDataConnector data connector (GCP_IAM Parser or Table)

This solution installs the Playbook templates to help implement your Security Orchestration, Automation and Response (SOAR) operations. After installing the solution, these will be deployed under Playbook Templates in the Automation blade in Microsoft Sentinel. They can be configured and managed from the Manage solution view in Content Hub.
